name: Hawaiian Butter Mochi
description: Craving a crowd-pleasing dessert this holiday season that's easy on the effort yet big on flavor? Look no further than this baked Hawaiian mochi! It's a yummy treat – bouncy, not overly sweet, and simply divine.
keywords: Hawaiian butter mochi, baked mochi recipe, how to make mochi, how to make baked mochi, coconut mochi, butter mochi, coconut mochi recipe, butter mochi recipe, mochi recipe, Hawaiian dessert, coconut milk recipe, sweet rice flour recipe, chewy dessert, easy baking, gluten-free dessert, not-too-sweet Hawaiian butter coconut mochi, best baked mochi recipe, how to make authentic baked mochi

video.name: Hawaiian Butter Coconut Baked Mochi
video.description: Want a crowd-pleasing dessert that's easy on the effort yet big on flavor? Try this baked Hawaiian mochi! It's a yummy treat – bouncy, not overly sweet, and simply divine.

recipeIngredient: ¼ cup melted salted butter (and a bit of solid butter to grease pan)
8 oz mochiko flour (sweet glutinous rice flour)
recipeInstructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Butter an 8x6-inch baking pan then place parchment paper on the bottom and sides.
In a large bowl, mix eggs, sugar, coconut milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract until well combined.
Mix in sweet rice flour and baking powder.

Pour the mix into your prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour and 25 minutes or until top is golden. Allow to cool down completely then lift the whole cake straight out of the pan by using the parchment paper.
Cut into 12 squares with a sharp knife and enjoy.
